p: Continuous oral administration for 28 days of M. Stenopetala leaves aqueous extract for diabetic rats led to a significant decrease in serum urea, creatinine, ALT, AST and ALP (P < 0.05) as compared with DC showed significantly concentrated. This significant reduction was equivalent that occurred on application of glibenclamide. Levels of serum cholesterol remained unaltered in the extract treated, and glibenclamide treated groups when compared with control rats as shown in Table 3.
